page.title: 01Thorpe in Balne's landscape
page.content: This relatively flat area of agricultural land is dominated in the north-east by the six cooling towers of{Thorpe Marsh}power station.To the north-west the most prominant features are the trees of{Owston Wood}which protrude into the skyline like distant clouds on a stormy day.Running diagonally across this remote,but somehow pretty corner,is the main{ {London}to{Edinburgh}railway line,and a notice on a manned level crossing warns that{"Trains may pass this point {at speeds in excess of 100 miles per {hour"}! In the south-west corner the largest object to be seen is the newly landscaped tip of{Bentley Colliery} which rolls down to the edge of{Toll {Bar}village.Again most noticeable in the south-east of the region is the bulk of the power station.
